title: Fall airfare is cheap — very cheap — and other reasons for a quick autumn getaway
text:
CLOSE

When's the best time to fly? To take a dream vacation? To grab a quick getaway? Go in the fall.

There are three big reasons for that:

1. Airfare is cheap — very cheap

This year, in some cases, it’s even a little cheaper than had been anticipated. For example, back in July, I touted a round-trip fall flight to Rome for $450, a very good bargain. By late last week, the price had dropped to an amazing $301.

Don't miss out: Airfare to Europe is so darn cheap right now, you’ll kick yourself if you don’t go

Here are some more deals, all round-trip prices for travel in October or November. As always, prices can change without notice. They can also vary depending on the days of the week you fly; a search tool focusing on fall months can help you zero in on the best deals.

Domestic fall fares

Chicago to New Orleans, $70

Los Angeles to Philadelphia, $178

New York to Charleston, $117

San Francisco to Las Vegas, $81

Europe fall fares

Boston to Rome, $260

Boston to Paris, $339

Los Angeles to London, $332

Los Angeles to Prague, $521

New York to Paris, $296

New York to Madrid, $317

All these fares are cheap for a reason: Summer is over. Families aren’t flying, and neither are most of the rest of us, thanks to work obligations or upcoming commitments for holiday travel. But, this just might be the year to skip a Thanksgiving trip to go someplace else you and wallet will really be thankful for.

Remember, the days surrounding Thanksgiving will be expensive to fly domestically so travel before or after this period and always compare fares.

Don't dawdle: It's time to start shopping for Thanksgiving, Christmas flights

Southwest mega fare sale: Winter flights from $49 one way

2. The weather is great

Autumn brings out the best in many destinations: If you want to go skiing in the Alps or Tahoe in late November or early December, you can often do that, or enjoy fall foliage in New England in elsewhere, or relax on a beach in Florida or Hawaii.

Fall is a great time to enjoy lunch in an outdoor café in Paris or New York, and both cities have plenty of museums and theaters to visit when temperatures drop later in the day.

3. The crowds are smaller

Fall's reduced crowd levels don't mean you shouldn’t go online to reserve tickets to iconic attractions, but it does mean you're far more likely to get the time slots you want. (Photo: Givaga, Getty Images/iStockphoto)

There will always be plenty of visitors lining up to see the Eiffel Tower or Disney World or the helping to clog the 405 freeway in Los Angeles but the soul-crushing hordes of tourists we see in July typically drop to far more manageable numbers in October.

In a Halloween mood? These are the scariest theme park thrills at Disney and Universal

This doesn’t mean you shouldn’t go online to reserve tickets to iconic attractions, but it does mean you're far more likely to get the time slots you want.

One last reason to vacation in fall: Unlike summer, you won’t be competing for vacation days with everyone else in the office, meaning you have a much better shot of getting the time off you want.

description: Fall is the best time for a dream vacation, quick getaway or any flight since airfare is cheap, the weather's great and the summer crowds are gone.
